questions.question: The boy killed the spider. / The spider ................................... by the boy.
questions.description: In the simple past tense, we make the passive forms by putting was/were before the past participle form of the verb.

questions.question: He loves me. / I ..................................... by him.
questions.description: In the simple present tense, we make the passive verb forms by putting is/am/are before the past participle form of the verb.

questions.question: I bought a shirt yesterday. / A shirt ...................................... by me.
questions.description: In the simple past tense, we make the passive forms by putting was/were before the past participle form of the verb.

questions.question: I ate an apple. / An apple ........................................... by me.
questions.description: In the simple past tense, we make the passive verb from by putting was / were before the past participle form of the verb.

questions.question: I have invited all of my friends. / All of my friends ............................................. by me.
questions.description: In the simple present tense, we make the passive verb forms by putting has/have + been before the past participle form of the verb.

questions.question: I am reading a novel. / A novel ............................................ by me.
questions.description: In the present continuous tense, we make the passive verb forms by putting is/am/are + being before the past participle form of the verb.

questions.question: Janet will give you a present. / You ..................................... a present by Janet.
questions.description: In the simple future tense, we make the passive verb forms by putting will be before the past participle form of the verb.

questions.question: She will have helped me. / I ................................................ by her.
questions.description: In the future perfect tense, passive verb forms are made by putting will have been before the past participle form of the verb.

questions.question: I was watching a movie. / A movie .............................................. by me.
questions.description: In the present continuous tense, we make the passive verb forms by putting was / were + being before the past participle form of the verb.

questions.question: They carried the patient home. / The patient ...................................... home.
questions.description: In the simple past tense, we make the passive verb from by putting was / were before the past participle form of the verb.

questions.question: Do it at once. / ................................................ at once.
questions.description: When we convert imperatives into the passive, we use the structure 'let + object + be + past participle'.
